website_summaries.verdict: Progresses therapy and balance-related programs with innovation and preventative features.
pros: We love that this pad improves stability and heals injuries more quickly than other products
Progress is enhanced by using other equipment in conjunction with the pad
Noted to help heal those with ACL and MCL injuries
cons: Ideal for those who are comfortable with exercise equipment, however not beginners

website_summaries.verdict: This is the way to go if you're looking for a versatile stability cushion system that enables you to move up in difficulty as you improve.
pros: Comes in four different densities for different degrees of difficulty
Oval-shaped design comfortably fits your foot
cons: These cushions are a little on the expensive side

customer_reviews.title: I love this trainer!
customer_reviews.text: The more you use this, the better your balance becomes. I need knee replacement surgery in both knees. The surgeon wanted me to work on my strength and balance before I had the surgery. This really helps to work on your muscles. Much easier than the board over a ball idea!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra T

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I use one like it at physical therapy and needed to have one at home, this product is exactly as described, definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: A rehab addition
customer_reviews.text: My home physio suggested this addition to my rehab om a recent hip replacement. It is certainly challenging and is helping me return to improved balance and coordination. Would highly recommend. Came very quickly!
customer_reviews.author: watercolor

customer_reviews.title: So great for knee support
customer_reviews.text: I used this in PT for knee support and bought one to use at home.
customer_reviews.author: Bondage Cupcakes

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: After trying it for the first time at my friends house I couldn’t wait to get mine. My friend has been using his for over 10 years and finally got a new one. I love it !
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: My physical therapists have used these.
customer_reviews.text: I have had to use these in physical therapy several times. I have used it most recently for ankle strengthening. I have used one in the past for balance issues. I finally bought my own so that I could use it for preventive maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: L  Willis

customer_reviews.title: Great for leg strength and balance
customer_reviews.text: I used this in physical therapy after knee surgery. it was great for building up your leg strength and balance. becuase of the benefits o got from using it, I bought one for home.
customer_reviews.author: Locodoggie

customer_reviews.title: ... to help with my stability and this pad was perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to help with my stability and this pad was perfect for me. It helps me balance and keeps my knee comfortable on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Stella

customer_reviews.title: Stable - no - but that's its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small muscle movements in your leg. I had knee surgery and this works great pre and post PT workouts.
customer_reviews.author: David Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Theraband is the best when it comes to stability, sturdiness and durability
customer_reviews.author: Steven Oliver

customer_reviews.title: I had to have physical therapy to be able to ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to have physical therapy to be able to move around, due to a herniated disc. We used these during my therapy, and I decided to get one for home in case I need it in the future
customer_reviews.author: NoSaint Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Really helpful
customer_reviews.text: I used this in p.t. after my hip replacement surgery for balance. I wanted one for home and found it of course on Amazon! I love this and it does help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple, yet effective.
customer_reviews.text: Super simple, yet effective, in helping to strengthen ankles. Helps to reinforce balance -- something we all need as we age into our 70's.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Spriggs

customer_reviews.title: great for improving balance
customer_reviews.text: great for improving balance. I got one green and one blue (different densities)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Joint Replacement Rehabilitation.
customer_reviews.text: Simple, but great device for joint replacement rehabilitation. However, also very useful for developing general physical fitness. Forces the user to seek balance in all movements
customer_reviews.author: Paul T. Klenk

customer_reviews.title: Helpful with doing strengthening exercises
customer_reviews.text: This helps me with my exercises that I do to strengthen my lower back, legs and hips. Standing on a stack of telephone books is not as effective or safe, and this product does the job best.
customer_reviews.author: Vi

customer_reviews.title: Theraband Stability Trainer
customer_reviews.text: The stability trainer is awsome for rehab from back surgery. Using it helps you to learn again how to stand on uneven surfaces. It is a fun way to try out how long you can stay balanced on one foot. I definitly would recommend it to anyone needing balance training.
customer_reviews.author: Gigas2

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Came across this from my chiropractor. I have MS and trouble w/ balance and stabilization. Really tones butt and thighs w/o a lot of effort. Has also helped w/ my balance...
customer_reviews.author: Mari D.

customer_reviews.title: Thera-Band is terrific
customer_reviews.text: I use this same trainer for my Achilles tendon physical therapy.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: great item
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is helpful in balancing the body and strengthening weak legs/ankles. I use it daily and it holds up to alot of weight.
customer_reviews.author: warriortwila

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: A great tool for practicing balance, especially after knee surgery
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Miracles
customer_reviews.text: I'm a ballet dancer and was out of dance for 5 weeks with tendinitis in my ankles (not fun). And so my ankles were a little weak getting back to dance. But because I'm doing exercises with this thing, I'm dancing better than ever! Thank you so much!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robin L. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Equine Use!
customer_reviews.text: I utilize these for PT with horses and it stands up to the wear and tear horse hooves and arena sand dish at it. Well made, easy to transport, and use. Recommend to anyone needing a hardy PT tool.
customer_reviews.author: Lara Burau

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Same one as used in my husband's therapy. He uses it every day and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Sitko

customer_reviews.title: used at physical therapy...does what I need it to do at home
customer_reviews.text: I used this at physical therapy and wanted to get one for at home to keep my knee strong after a knee replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Casey

customer_reviews.title: strengthening a weaken ankle
customer_reviews.text: It stands about 8-inches above the ground when planted on the floor. The 'green' stability trainer is a firm surface, and idea for strengthening a weak ankle. Sprain my ankle 4-out-5 ligaments damaged, and I am starting band exercises. Note I have not yet used it, but I can tell you it has 'firm surface' & comes with a instruction manual for additional exercises for the individual doesn't know any balancing exercise. Within one month I should be able to stand using it. It is what I expected
customer_reviews.author: PoohBear

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It definitely helped with my stability and rehab for my foot & ankle
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Stability trainer
customer_reviews.text: Use one at rehab, so what can I say? I got exactly what I expected. I would advise using the beginner board and moving up to the more advanced model. In my case, I had a stroke and regaining balance can be a slow process.
customer_reviews.author: B. T. Hord

customer_reviews.title: Great training aid
customer_reviews.text: Slightly smaller and firmer than the blue one. I bought the green and the blue stability trainer, and probably could have gotten by with the blue one. I am using it to rehab my hip and it is really helping me get to another level. I am doing around the world (4 way hip) with a resistance band on one ankle while balancing on the opposite foot.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Thera-Band Stability - meets expectatations... great quality
customer_reviews.text: This product is just like the one I used at my physical therapy appointments. It saved me a few bucks buying it online. I'm perfectly happy with it. I don't know enough about how these pads are made, but suspect if the same exact product was a toy instead of a health product it would be half the cost to the consumer. Opinion: I'm not sure saving a few bucks is worth putting cash into Amazon's hands and out of the local community.
customer_reviews.author: beastdk

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for working out to improve physical balance. This is the same product that my physical therapist uses during therapy.
customer_reviews.author: Gustav Getter

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: This stability trainer was used by my PT to address my increasing ataxia. I purchased two of these to continue my physical therapy @ home. They have held up well & are a great addition to my PT equipment due to their size.
customer_reviews.author: annie

customer_reviews.title: to love a device that makes you work and hurt doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it 5 stars but, to love a device that makes you work and hurt doesn't seem right. However it does deserve all 5.I got one of these after using the same brand at physical therapy, for recovery from a total knee replacement. Trying to keep your balance with one foot on this isn't easy, and makes you use all the leg muscle and connective tissues. Well that's the point of it. It's not fun, but it's an extremely good workout for my atrophied right leg, and I am getting better. Charles
customer_reviews.author: whitewater

customer_reviews.title: Too Hard
customer_reviews.text: Way too firm. I had plan on using it as I do in my physical therapy but it's way too hard. I'm afraid that it will injury my foot again. I will return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: stable is good
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great for someone who's working on ankle strength and balance issues. Be careful not to fall though.
customer_reviews.author: JacK Trades

customer_reviews.title: A knee pad for all
customer_reviews.text: The pad is durable and stable. I’ve had knee surgery and this pad gives the right amount of give.
customer_reviews.author: VICKIE L BEEKLEY

customer_reviews.title: more info on the amazon page would be nice.
customer_reviews.text: I've got these for a different purpose - seems like the one customer review is not of the product but rather of the way the person ordered. Fine to return and order the blue series or whatever, but weird to downrate the product because of an incorrect order. That said, more data on the product page could be of value - as this says "series" and I'm not sure if it gets you a pair or a set of three pairs.... based on the price, probably one pair.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Simple way to exercise!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to develop balance, it strengthens the muscles that help you balance.
customer_reviews.author: Roger O. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: great for ankle rehabilitation
customer_reviews.text: This is the same stability trainer my physical therapist has in her office. I bought my own so I could do the exercises at home. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dav

product_meta.title: TheraBand Stability Trainer Pad, Beginner Level Green Foam Pad, Balance Trainer & Wobble Cushion for Balance & Core Strengthening, Rehabilitation, Physical Therapy, Round Sport Balance Trainer
product_meta.description: 23303 Color: Black Features: -Stability Trainer. Options: -Available in black, blue and green colors. Dimensions: -Firm: 14.5'' H x 8'' W x 1.75'' D.-Soft: 16'' H x 9'' W x 2'' D.-X-Soft: 17.25'' H x 10.12'' W x 2'' D.
feature_bullets: Oval-shaped, color coded pad made of durable PVC, molded in closed-cell foam with an anti-slip ridged surface

For balance and proprioception training, core, upper and lower extremity strength and stability training, ankle range of motion and flexibility training, sensorimotor training, closed kinetic chain exercises, targeted injury prevention and strengthening
Two options for use: one surface with rounded points providing tactile inputs for sensorimotor training; and the opposite surface with an anti-skid bars that resist slipping
TheraBand balance products are available in four densities to provide a progressive system of balance training for rehab, post-rehab conditioning and fitness applications
Contains (1) - Green, Firm, Beginner, 14.5" x 8" x 1.75" Pad
